Sea ice albedo and short wave radiation is calculated with the Delta-Eddington scheme implemented in CICE and CCSM4 (Holland 2011; Briegleb and Light 2007). This scheme uses  microscopic inherent optical properties as scattering and absorption of snow, ice, melt ponds and included absorbers (black carbon and dust) to calculate macroscopic properties as albedo, transmittance, and total energy absorbed. Compared with CCSM4, NorESM1-M uses an increased snow grain size for cold snow to lower the albedo. This is done to increase summer melt of snow. Deposition of aerosols (black carbon and dust) on snow and ice are calculated interactively in the atmosphere model.
